channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing bins, 23rd August
item.description:
Two bins crammed to overflowing, broken glass on pavement and dumped timber

item.title: Bags of rubbish dumped in alley, 23rd August

item.title: Old bed dumped and rubbish accumulating, 23rd August
item.description:
I reported the divan bed that was left at the end of Mayplace Lane/Brinklow Crescent before - it is still there. Also Black rubbish bags are now accumulating there blocking my neighbours garage. The divan bed is blocking access to ours. it has been there for several months now despite reporting it.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins constantly put on the pavement, 23rd August
item.description:
Bins constantly left on the pavement, near back door of 105 Eden Park Avenue and 1 Cherry Tree Walk. They obstructed the public footpath. Bins should be put on their own driveway on collection days and never should obstruct public pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Cherry Tree Walk, Upper Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Overflowing Bins, not collected, 23rd August
item.description:

item.title: British flags put up on lampposts along Nuxkey Road, 23rd August
item.description:
I asked in a shop if they knew who had put the flags up and apparently 2 men on a bike with a ladder did it late one night. Not only is this vandalism of public property, but also may be linked to far-right groups.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nuxley Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
